CATALOGUE
O F T H E
CURIOUS md VALUABLE
COLLECTION
O F
Greek and R oman Coins
and Medals,
In GOLD, SILVER, and COPPER,
And other Antiquities,
OF THE LATE
Rev.
Mr. CROFTS,
Chancellor of Peterborough:
WHICH WILL BE
SOLD by AUCTION, By Mr. GERARD,
At his Houfe, in
LI TCH FI ELD-STREET,
St. ANNE's, SOHO,
On TUESDAY the 26th, WEDNESDAY the 27th, and THURSDAY the 28th, of March, 1782. To be viewed on Saturday the 23d, Monday the 25th, arid till
the Time of Sale, which will begin at Half an Hour after Eleven o'clock precifely.
Catalogues to be had at Mr. Gerard's aforcfaid.
Conditions of Sale.
h<J^H E highejl bidder to be the buyer; and, if any
difpute Jhall arife between any two or more bid ders, the lotfo difputed to be put up again.
II. No per[on to advance lefs thanfixpence; above
one pound, one Jhilling ; andfo in proportion.
III. The purchafers are to give in their names and
places of abode, if required, and to pay down fiveJhil-
lings in the pound in part of the pur chafe-money ; in de fault of which, the lot or lots fo pur chafed to be imme
diately put up again and refold.
IV. The lots to be taken away, with all faults, at
the buyer's expence, within three days after the fale.
V. To prevent the many inconveniencesthat frequently attend long and open accounts, the remainder of the pur-
hafe-money to be abfolutely paid on or before the delivery.
Lafily. Upon failure of complying with the above conditions, the money, fo depofited in part of payment,
(hall be forfeited
-,
the lots, uncleared within the time a-
forefaid, fijall be re fold by public or private fale; and
the deficiency, (if any,) together with the charges atten
dingfuch re-fale, Jhall be made good by the defaulters at
this fale.
